job_description:
Why BCAA?

Feel proud of what you do and help shape the future of BC at a BC Top Employer. We’re driven by purpose – delivering peace of mind to one in three BC households with insurance, roadside assistance, auto repair, Evo Car Share and Evolve E-Bike Share. With a long history of keeping roads safe and giving back in ways that build stronger communities

We are currently hiring a Senior Software Developer Analyst based in our Burnaby Head Office. BCAA supports a hybrid work environment which requires in office presence on a part-time basis.

As a Senior Software Developer, you will be part of our SCRUM teams responsible for delivery of exceptional business systems and web sites through IT process automation.

Who You Are
You have worked extensively on both Web development .NET MVC and Java micro-services and legacy Java business applications development.
You are also passionate about DevOps and understand the importance of collaboration between software Development, QA and Operational teams.
You understand Continuous Integration, Continuous Delivery and infrastructure provisioning are important to reduce cycle time.
Agile and SCRUM are under your skin and you enjoy spreading their adoption and making them better in ways that align with our culture.
You provide leadership and assistance to less experienced team members in more complex situations.
You provide leadership and assistance to less experienced team members in more complex situations.
Excellent written and verbal communicator

What You'll Do
Leads design, development and documentation of a sophisticated and comprehensive product suite.
Provide technical direction, participates in hiring and mentor developers.
Develop an in-depth understanding of our applications and provides ideas to improve them.
Participate in the creation and review of architectural designs.
Develop and conducts unit, integration, performance and regression testing.
Participate in all Scrum activities such as Backlog Grooming, Sprint Planning, Sprint demos, Retrospectives, etc.
Scope and estimate work
Fix production issues
Carrie out other related tasks and projects as agreed upon by team.
Relentlessly seek out continuous improvement opportunities.
Carry out other related tasks and projects as assigned.

What You Bring
Degree or Diploma in Computing Science, Business Administration, or Management Information Systems
Minimum of 7 years of code integration in application development. Equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered
HTML5, W3C standards, CSS3, SASS, JavaScript, JQuery, EcmaScript 6, Fractal Build, Grunt, Gulp, AngularJS, ReactJS
ASP.net MVC, Razor View, Visual Studio 2022, C#, .NET
Java, JEE, EKS, Microservices, Shell or Python or Perl or other scripting languages, JBoss, MS SQL.
Mobile first web design, Responsive web design
Sitecore CMS development, Web API integration
Strong understanding of relational databases, and significant experience writing SQL queries to store and retrieve data
Experience in IT process automation, continuous integration, and cloud development on AWS, Bamboo, Git, New Relic, Jenkins
Demonstrated ability in the development and analysis of technical specifications
Demonstrated ability in design and architecture modeling

Bonus skills!
Experience with the Agile approach to software development
Comfortable facilitating meetings and consensus building.

Internal Applicants: Please note that this is a Grade 14 role and the internal posting will close on Feb 13th.
